Upcycle a plastic bottle into a beautiful vase for fresh flowers or dried flowers. This can be done by cutting the bottle in half and removing the cap, then using a hot glue gun to glue the edges together. Once the glue is dry, use a drill to make holes for the stems of the flowers. Add some decorative paint or stickers to give it a personalized touch.

Transform a plastic bottle into a unique planter for small plants or herbs. Cut the bottle in half and use a sharp knife to remove any sharp edges. Use a spoon to scoop out some of the insides of the bottle to create a small hole for drainage. Add some potting soil and plant your favorite herbs or small plants inside.

Create a plastic bottle bird feeder by cutting a small hole in the side of the bottle and filling it with birdseed. Hang the bottle from a tree using a piece of twine or fishing line. This will provide a convenient source of food for birds and other small animals.

Use a plastic bottle as a self-watering pot for your plants. Cut the bottle in half and use a spoon to scoop out some of the insides to create a small hole for drainage. Add some potting soil and plant your favorite plant inside. As the plant grows, it will absorb the water from the bottle, providing it with the necessary moisture.

Create a unique candle holder by cutting a plastic bottle in half and using it as a mold for a homemade candle. Melt some wax and pour it into the bottle, making sure to fill it to the top. Use a toothpick or skewer to create a design on the top of the candle. Once the wax is cooled and hardened, remove the candle from the bottle and enjoy your new candle holder.
